text: One always begins to forgive a place as soon as it's left behind.
author: Charles Dickens

text: Only I can change my life. No one can do it for me.
author: Carol Burnett

text: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Man is affected not by events but by the view he takes of them.
author: Seneca

text: When you love someone, you love the person as they are, and not as you'd like them to be.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: No amount of regretting can change the past, and no amount of worrying can change the future.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: Intelligent men are cruel. Stupid men are monstrously cruel.
author: Jack London

text: Half the world is composed of people who have something to say and can't, and the other half who have nothing to say and keep on saying it.
author: Robert Frost

text: If the plan doesn't work, change the plan, but never the goal.
author: Unknown

text: Rich people have small TVs and big libraries, and poor people have small libraries and big TVs.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: Never take your position for granted and never let any favors you receive go to your head.
author: Robert Greene

text: Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much.
author: Helen Keller

text: Real loss is only possible when you love something more than you love yourself.
author: Robin Williams

text: Our heart is a treasury; if you pour out all its wealth at once, you are bankrupt.
author: Honore de Balzac

text: Your mind will make you rich or poor, depending on the use you put to it.
author: Brian Tracy

text: Begin now to be what you will be hereafter.
author: St. Jerome

text: Your world is a living expression of how you are using and have used your mind.
author: Earl Nightingale

text: Although the world is full of suffering, it is also full of the overcoming of it.
author: Helen Keller

text: There are two primary choices in life: to accept conditions as they exist, or accept the responsibility for changing them.
author: Denis Waitley

text: Those who seek the easy way do not seek the true way.
author: Dogen

text: I am always doing what I cannot do yet, in order to learn how to do it.
author: Vincent van Gogh

text: A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes.
author: Mark Twain

text: Whenever you do a thing, act as if all the world were watching.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: The act of taking the first step is what separates the winners from the losers.
author: Brian Tracy

text: A Hero is an ordinary individual who finds the strength to persevere and endure in spite of overwhelming obstacles.
author: Christopher Reeve

text: Beware of false knowledge, it is more dangerous than ignorance.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Age is a very high price to pay for maturity.
author: William James

text: Lost Time is never found again.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Riches don't make a man rich, they only make him busier.
author: Christopher Columbus

text: Opportunity often comes disguised in the form of misfortune or temporary defeat.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: The quieter you become, the more you are able to hear.
author: Rumi

text: Peace is not absence of conflict, it is the ability to handle conflict by peaceful means.
author: Ronald Reagan

text: The less people know, the more stubbornly they know it.
author: Osho

text: The only thing more frustrating than slanderers is those foolish enough to listen to them.
author: Criss Jami

text: Trust is the foundation of great leadership.
author: Lolly Daskal

text: Success is achieved and maintained by those who try and keep trying.
author: W. Clement Stone

text: Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: The best of us sometimes eat our words.
author: Albus Dumbledore

text: Greatest success comes just one step beyond the point at which defeat overtakes you.
author: Unknown

text: I believe that potential is unlimited - success depends on daring to act on dreams.
author: Estee Lauder

text: What do we live for, if it is not to make life less difficult for each other?
author: George Eliot

text: Time you enjoy wasting, was not wasted.
author: John Lennon

text: When you're curious, you find lots of interesting things to do.
author: Walt Disney

text: Don't explain your philosophy. Embody it.
author: Epictetus

text: Take responsibility of your own happiness, never put it in other people's hands.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: Be still when you have nothing to say; when genuine passion moves you, say what you've got to say, and say it hot.
author: D. H. Lawrence

text: He who is not contented with what he has, would not be contented with what he would like to have.
author: Socrates

text: The only reason to be alive is to enjoy it.
author: Rita Mae Brown

text: There are only two ways to live your life. One is as if nothing is a miracle. The other is as if everything is a miracle.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Life does not get better by chance, it gets better by change.
author: Jim Rohn

text: It's not what we do once in a while that shapes our lives, but what we do consistently.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Health is the greatest of all possessions.
author: Jonathan Swift

text: The man who asks a question is a fool for a minute, the man who does not ask is a fool for life.
author: Confucius

text: Successful people ask better questions, and as a result, they get better answers.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Enlightenment is intimacy with all things.
author: Dogen

text: Be - don't try to become
author: Osho

text: Weeds are flowers too, once you get to know them.
author: A.A. Milne

text: To lose your temper is only useful once a year.
author: Colin R. Davis

text: The goal is not to be perfect by the end, the goal is to be better today.
author: Simon Sinek

text: Instead of thinking about what you are going to do when you retire, think about how you can do that now and make a living from it.
author: Celestine Chua

text: Do not fight with pigs - you will be smeared in mud but the pig will like it.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Life can only be understood backwards; but it must be lived forwards.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

text: All human wisdom is contained in these two words - Wait and Hope
author: Alexandre Dumas

text: Only one thing is ever guaranteed, that is that you will definitely not achieve the goal if you don't take the shot.
author: Wayne Gretzky

text: When it hurts - observe. Life is trying to teach you something.
author: Anita Krizzan

text: Chop your own wood and it will warm you twice.
author: Henry Ford

text: Never let the things you can't do stop you from doing what you can.
author: Ronald Reagan

text: The season of failure is the best time for sowing the seeds of success.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

text: One machine can do the work of fifty ordinary men. No machine can do the work of one extraordinary man.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: There can be no greater gift than that of giving one's time and energy to help others without expecting anything in return.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Enthusiasm makes up for a host of deficiencies.
author: Barack Obama

text: Life is the dancer and you are the dance.
author: Eckhart Tolle

text: Have the courage to follow your heart and intuition. They somehow know what you truly want to become.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Everybody's life is either rewarding or an example.
author: Tony Robbins

text: To succeed takes more than the desire to win. It also takes the acceptance that we could fail.
author: Simon Sinek

text: Falling down is not failure. Failure comes when you stay where you have fallen.
author: Socrates

text: It isn't that they can't see the solution. It is that they can't see the problem.
author: Gilbert Chesterton

text: The future belongs to those who learn more skills and combine them in creative ways.
author: Robert Greene

text: There is only one thing in the world worse than being talked about, and that is not being talked about.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Be fascinated instead of frustrated.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Distant water does not put out a nearby fire.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Don't blame others. it won't make you a better person.
author: Lolly Daskal

text: To belittle, you have to be little.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another.
author: Charles Dickens

text: The quality of your commitments will determine the course of your life.
author: Ralph Marston

text: The clock indicates the moment...but what does eternity indicate?
author: Walt Whitman

text: There are more people who wish to be loved than there are who are willing to love.
author: Nicolas Chamfort

text: Unless a man is master of his soul, all other kinds of mastery amount to little.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: People are not disturbed by things, but by the views they take of them.
author: Epictetus

text: Concentrated power has always been the enemy of liberty.
author: Ronald Reagan

text: Human behavior flows from three main sources: desire, emotion, and knowledge.
author: Plato

text: The key to immortality is first living a life worth remembering.
author: Bruce Lee

text: There are no mistakes in life, only lessons.
author: Robin Sharma

text: Be as simple as you can be; you will be astonished to see how uncomplicated and happy your life can become.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

text: Don't spend time beating on a wall, hoping to transform it into a door.
author: Coco Chanel

text: Why do you stay in prison when the door is so wide open?
author: Rumi

text: Happiness comes when you believe in what you are doing, know what you are doing, and love what you are doing.
author: Brian Tracy

text: Do anything, but let it produce joy.
author: Walt Whitman

text: If we learn to open our hearts, anyone, including the people who drive us crazy, can be our teacher.
author: Pema Chodron

text: Just because you are happy it does not mean that the day is perfect but that you have looked beyond its imperfections.
author: Bob Marley

text: Ripe fruit falls by itself - but it doesn't fall in your mouth.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Progress is limited by your ability to change your mind.
author: Jack Butcher

text: If you want to see things just as they are, then you yourself must practice just as you are.
author: Dogen

text: Simplicity is a difficult thing to achieve.
author: Charlie Chaplin

text: Tenderness and kindness are not signs of weakness and despair, but manifestations of strength and resolution.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: You cannot find peace avoiding life.
author: Virginia Woolf

text: There's no next time. It's now or never.
author: Celestine Chua

text: Continuous effort - not strength or intelligence - is the key to unlocking our potential.
author: Winston Churchill

text: The mind can calculate, but the spirit yearns, and the heart wants what the heart wants.
author: Stephen King

text: Absorb what is useful, discard what is useless and add what is specifically your own.
author: Bruce Lee

text: If you want to find the secrets of the universe, think in terms of energy, frequency and vibration.
author: Nikola Tesla

text: Either get busy living or get busy dying.
author: Stephen King

text: One reason so few of us achieve what we truly want is that we never direct our focus; we never concentrate our power.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Wheresoever you go, go with all your heart.
author: Confucius

text: We lie the loudest when we lie to ourselves.
author: Eric Hoffer

text: Any fool can turn a blind eye but who knows what the ostrich sees in the sand.
author: Samuel Beckett

text: If it entertains you now but will bore you someday, it's a distraction. Keep looking.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: Nothing is impossible. The word itself says 'I'm possible!'
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: There is no limit to the amount of good you can do if you don't care who gets the credit.
author: Ronald Reagan

text: Re-examine all that you have been told... dismiss that which insults your soul.
author: Walt Whitman

text: Life goes by very fast. And the worst thing in life that you can have is a job that you hate, and have no energy and creativity in.
author: Robert Greene

text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Hope and fear come from feeling that we lack something; they come from a sense of poverty.
author: Pema Chodron

text: It's easy to be a critic, but being a doer requires effort, risk, and change.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: All I can do is be me, whoever that is.
author: Bob Dylan

text: Even when a friend does something you do not like, he continues to be your friend.
author: Genghis Khan

text: When the mind is calm, how quickly, how smoothly, how beautifully you will perceive everything.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

text: Only in the agony of parting do we look into the depths of love.
author: George Eliot

text: If he cannot stop the mind that seeks after fame and profit, he will spend his life without finding peace.
author: Dogen

text: Always keep your eyes open. Keep watching. Because whatever you see can inspire you.
author: Grace Coddington

text: Don't gain the world and lose your soul. Wisdom is better than silver and gold.
author: Bob Marley

text: Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night.
author: Vincent van Gogh

text: Love is the absence of judgment.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Change will not come if we wait for some other person, or if we wait for some other time.
author: Barack Obama

text: Take the attitude of a student. Never be too big to ask questions. Never know too much to learn something new.
author: Og Mandino

text: To share your weakness is to make yourself vulnerable; to make yourself vulnerable is to show your strength.
author: Criss Jami

text: Education breeds confidence. Confidence breeds hope. Hope breeds peace.
author: Confucius

text: We must cultivate our garden.
author: Voltaire

text: We are all self-made, but only the successful will admit it.
author: Earl Nightingale

text: The biggest mistake we could ever make in our lives is to think we work for anybody but ourselves.
author: Brian Tracy

text: The opposite of courage in our society is not cowardice... it is conformity.
author: Earl Nightingale

text: Obstacles don't block the path, they are the path.
author: Zen Proverb

text: The right thing to do and the hard thing to do are usually the same.
author: Steve Maraboli

text: Failure is simply the opportunity to begin again, this time more intelligently.
author: Henry Ford

text: Happiness must be grown in one's own garden.
author: Mary Engelbreit

text: Anger, ego, jealousy are the biggest diseases,Keep yourself aloof from these three diseases.
author: Sathya Sai Baba

text: Don?t hesitate or allow yourself to make excuses. Just get out and do it.
author: Christopher McCandless

text: A comfort zone is a beautiful place, but nothing ever grows there.
author: Unknown

text: As a man thinketh in his heart, so shall he be.
author: James Allen

text: Have a vision. Be demanding.
author: Colin Powell

text: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: A hut full of laughter is richer than a palace full of sadness.
author: Zen Proverb

text: Formal education will make you a living, self-education will make you a fortune.
author: Jim Rohn

text: You are never too old to become younger.
author: Mae West

text: Some of your greatest lessons come from your darkest moments.
author: Roger Lee

text: Ancient Rule of Twenty-one: if you do anything for twenty-one days in a row, it will be installed as a habit.
author: Robin Sharma

text: The only place success comes before work is in the dictionary.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: The older you get, the better you get. Unless you're a banana.
author: Betty White

text: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: A mistake is only an error, it becomes a mistake when you fail to correct it.
author: John Lennon

text: The key to success is to focus our conscious mind on things we desire not things we fear.
author: Brian Tracy

text: The difference between impossible and possible is a willing heart.
author: Lolly Daskal

text: If your mind is empty, it is always ready for anything, it is open to everything.
author: Shunryu Suzuki

text: It's not how much we give but how much love we put into giving.
author: Mother Teresa

text: When angry count to ten before you speak. If very angry, count to one hundred.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: The less you try to impress, the more peaceful you can be.
author: Maxime Lagace

text: Only by attracting the best people will you accomplish great deeds.
author: Colin Powell

text: To affect the quality of the day, that is the highest of arts.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Just do what must be done. This may not be happiness but it is greatness.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Life is one long process of getting tired.
author: Samuel Butler

text: The heart that gives, gathers.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Small men think they are small; great men never know they are great.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: No experience is a cause of success or failure. We do not suffer from the shock of our experiences, so-called trauma ? but we make out of them just what suits our purposes.
author: Alfred Adler

text: Some changes look negative on the surface but you will soon realize that space is being created in your life for something new to emerge.
author: Eckhart Tolle

text: What are we doing here, that is the question.
author: Samuel Beckett

text: Of all men's miseries the bitterest is this: to know so much and to have control over nothing.
author: Herodotus

text: If you chase two rabbits, you catch none.
author: Confucius

text: The world only exists in your eyes. You can make it as big or as small as you want.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

text: You need to be doing fewer things for more effect instead of doing more things with side effects.
author: Gary Keller

text: Contemplation often makes life miserable.  We should act more, think less, and stop watching ourselves live.
author: Nicolas Chamfort

text: Receive without complaint, Work with fate.
author: Ming-Dao Deng

text: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: If you want something then you lose everything. If you don't want anything then you already have everything.
author: Seungsahn

text: It takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to our enemies, but just as much to stand up to our friends.
author: Albus Dumbledore

text: Genius is patience.
author: Isaac Newton

text: You must be willing to do what others won't do, to have what others won't have.
author: Les Brown

text: Outstanding people have one thing in common: an absolute sense of mission.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: To love means loving the unlovable.
author: Gilbert Chesterton

text: Absurdity is the ecstasy of intellectualism.
author: Criss Jami

text: There is a big difference between being centered and being self-centered.
author: Lolly Daskal

text: Some men see things as they are and ask why. Others dream things that never were and ask why not.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: To forgive means pardoning the unpardonable.
author: Gilbert Chesterton

text: The biggest adventure is what lies ahead.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: At the end of the day, let there be no excuses, no explanations, no regrets.
author: Steve Maraboli

text: People who have goals succeed because they know where they're going. It's that simple.
author: Earl Nightingale

text: Throw your heart over the fence and the rest will follow
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: The temptation to give up is strongest just before victory.
author: Zen Proverb

text: Doing what you love is the cornerstone of having abundance in your life.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: You are today where your thoughts have brought you.
author: James Allen

text: What the caterpillar calls the end of the world, the master calls a butterfly.
author: Richard Bach

text: As a matter of fact is an expression that precedes many an expression that isn't.
author: Laurence J. Peter

text: If you genuinely want something, don't wait for it - teach yourself.
author: Gurbaksh Chahal

text: Where focus goes, energy flows.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Words are clothes that thoughts wear
author: Samuel Butler

text: Be strong. Be confident. Be the star of your own life.
author: Estee Lauder

text: Respect was invented to cover the empty place where love should be.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: Enjoy when you can, and endure when you must.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: Play your part in life, but never forget that it is only a role.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

text: To know even one life has breathed easier because you have lived. This is to have succeeded.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: A person who does not read is no better than one cannot read.
author: Earl Nightingale

text: It is the nature of the wise to resist pleasures, but the foolish to be a slave to them.
author: Epictetus

text: I am not absentminded. It is the presence of mind that makes me unaware of everything else.
author: Gilbert Chesterton

text: The journey, not the destination matters.
author: T.S. Eliot

text: A good character is the best tombstone. Carve your name on hearts, not on marble.
author: Charles Spurgeon

text: Discipline yourself, and others won't need to.
author: John Wooden

text: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The decisions of our past are the architects of our present.
author: Dan Brown

text: Men go to far greater lengths to avoid what they fear than to obtain what they desire.
author: Dan Brown

text: He who possesses most must be most afraid of loss.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: One of the oldest human needs is having someone to wonder where you are when you don't come home at night.
author: Margaret Mead

text: Keep your eyes on the stars, but remember to keep your feet on the ground.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Persistence is very important. You should not give up unless you are forced to give up.
author: Elon Musk

text: The destiny of man is in his own soul.
author: Herodotus

text: We learn by pushing ourselves and finding what really lies at the outer reaches of our abilities.
author: Josh Waitzkin

text: Don't talk about what you have done or what you are going to do.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Your purpose will be clear only when you listen to your heart.
author: Lolly Daskal

text: Sadness is but a wall between two gardens.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: When you get up in the morning, you have two choices - either to be happy or to be unhappy. Just choose to be happy.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: Be not glad at the misfortune of another, though he may be your enemy.
author: George Washington

text: It's your life-but only if you make it so.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: It is secondary whether we choose belief or defiance. What is precious is that we are always able to choose.
author: Ming-Dao Deng

text: All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make, the better.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: You can put lipstick on a pig. It's still a pig.
author: Barack Obama

text: A man, as a general rule, owes very little to what he is born with - a man is what he makes of himself.
author: Alexander Graham Bell

text: A goal is a dream with a deadline.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: Every limit is a beginning as well as an ending.
author: George Eliot

text: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Confucius

text: You are not what you think you are, You are not what others think you are, You are what you think others think you are.
author: Unknown

text: Work as though you would live forever, and live as though you would die today. Go another mile.
author: Og Mandino

text: Don't think money does everything or you are going to end up doing everything for money.
author: Voltaire

text: Raise your words, not voice. It is rain that grows flowers, not thunder.
author: Rumi

text: The most important thing is to enjoy your life, to be happy, it's all that matters.
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: How much pain they have cost us, the evils which have never happened.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Procrastination is attitude's natural assassin. There's nothing so fatiguing as an uncompleted task.
author: William James

text: The power of man has grown in every sphere, except over himself.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Love your enemies, for they tell you your faults.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Patience is a form of wisdom. It demonstrates that we understand and accept the fact that sometimes things must unfold in their own time.
author: Jon Kabat-Zinn

text: To be alive - is Power.
author: Emily Dickinson

text: The single biggest problem in communication is the illusion that it has taken place.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Trusting our intuition often saves us from disaster.
author: Anne Wilson Schaef
